intro: Zomicarpella amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elongated, fleshy fruits that resemble star-shaped berries. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study. The species is relatively rare and is often found in humid, shaded environments within the Amazon basin.
